listeningQuestion.question: Why was Campbell disappointed after his attempt?
listeningQuestion.translation: 为什么坎贝尔在尝试后感到失望？

editorNotes: 本课讲述了赛车选手马尔科姆·坎贝尔爵士创造世界纪录的故事。文章介绍了他在犹他州邦纳维尔盐滩驾驶'蓝鸟'汽车创造速度纪录的经历，以及他儿子唐纳德后来也创造世界纪录的故事。文章通过这个生动的故事，展示了不定式作定语、介词per的用法、have difficulty in doing结构等语法点，以及一些表示'速度'、'困难'和'继承'的表达方式。文章还展示了如何描述历史事件和科技成就，以及一些常见的英语表达方式。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
notes: The great racing driver, Sir Malcolm Campbell, was the first man to drive at over 300 miles per hour.
He set up a new world record in September 1935 at Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah.
Bluebird, the car he was driving, had been specially built for him.
It was over 30 feet in length and had a 2,500-horsepower engine.
Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run.
After his attempt, Campbell was disappointed to learn that his average speed had been 299 miles per hour.
However, a few days later, he was told that a mistake had been made.
His average speed had been 301 miles per hour.
Since that time, racing drivers have reached speeds over 600 miles an hour.
Following in his father's footsteps many years later, Sir Malcolm's son, Donald, also set up a world record.
Like his father, he was driving a car called Bluebird.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 杰出的赛车选手马尔科姆·坎贝尔爵士是第一个以每小时超过300英里的速度驾车的人。
他于1935年9月在犹他州的邦纳维尔盐滩创造了一项新的世界纪录。
他驾驶的'蓝鸟'牌汽车是专门为他制造的。
它的车身长30英尺，有一个2,500马力的发动机。
尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，但他很难把汽车控制住，因为在开始的行程中爆了一只轮胎。
比赛结束后，坎贝尔非常失望地得知他的平均时速是299英里。
然而，几天之后，有人告诉他说弄错了。
他的平均时速实际是301英里。
从那时以来，赛车选手已达到每小时600英里的速度。
很多年之后，马尔科姆爵士的儿子唐纳德踏着父亲的足迹，也创造了一项世界纪录。
同他父亲一样，他也驾驶着一辆名叫'蓝鸟'的汽车。

notes.title: 不定式作定语
content: 在the second，the next/the last以及表示最高级的如the best，the most intelligent等后可以用to引导的不定式短语做定语。
例如：She's always the first to arrive and the last to leave.（她总是第一个到，最后一个离开。）
You're the best person to advise me about buying a house.（你是我买房子的最好顾问。）
the only后必须接一个名词或one(s)：You're the only person/one to complain.（你是唯一抱怨的人。）

notes.title: 介词per的用法
content: per表示'每一，每'，通常用于商业及技术用语，日常用语大多用a/an。
例如：You can stay at the hotel at $10 per person per night.（你可以在旅馆住，每人每晚10美元。）
You must have been driving at seventy miles an/per hour.（你一定是以每小时70英里的速度行驶的。）

notes.title: have difficulty (in) doing结构
content: have difficulty (in) doing sth.表示'做...有困难'。
例如：He has grown a beard and I had difficulty (in) recognizing him.（他留了胡子，我很难认出他来。）
Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car.（尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，但他很难控制汽车。）

notes.title: follow in one's footsteps
content: follow in one's footsteps表示'步某人的后尘，仿效某人，继承某人的事业'。
例如：He intends to follow in his father's footsteps and to become a dentist.（他打算继承父亲的事业，成为一名牙医。）
Following in his father's footsteps many years later, Sir Malcolm's son, Donald, also set up a world record.（很多年之后，马尔科姆爵士的儿子唐纳德踏着父亲的足迹，也创造了一项世界纪录。）

notes.example: He set up a new world record in September 1935 at Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah.
He had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run.

notes.translation: 步某人的后尘，仿效某人
notes.context: 表示继承某人的事业或仿效某人
notes.example: Following in his father's footsteps many years later, Sir Malcolm's son, Donald, also set up a world record.
A tyre burst during the first run.

multipleChoice.question: Sir Malcolm Campbell was the first man to drive at over 300 miles per hour. He was the first man ___ at over 300 miles per hour.
multipleChoice.explanation: 在表示'第一个做某事的人'时，用the first man to do结构。

multipleChoice.question: He had great difficulty in controlling the car. It was ___ for him to control the car.
multipleChoice.explanation: have difficulty in doing表示做某事有困难，所以选hard。

multipleChoice.question: Donald followed in his father's footsteps. He ___ his father.
multipleChoice.explanation: follow in one's footsteps表示仿效某人，所以选imitated。

fillInBlanks.sentence: Sir Malcolm Campbell was the first man ___ at over 300 miles per hour.
fillInBlanks.explanation: 在表示'第一个做某事的人'时，用the first man to do结构。

fillInBlanks.explanation: have difficulty (in) doing表示做某事有困难。

notes.title: 词汇辨析
notes.content:
1. Racing, Race和Competition的区别：
- racing: 竞赛，赛跑，赛车
  The great racing driver, Sir Malcolm Campbell, was the first man to drive at over 300 miles per hour.（杰出的赛车选手马尔科姆·坎贝尔爵士是第一个以每小时超过300英里的速度驾车的人。）

- race: 比赛，竞赛
  He won the race.（他赢得了比赛。）

- competition: 竞争，比赛
  There is fierce competition between the two companies.（这两家公司之间有激烈的竞争。）

2. Burst的用法：
- vi. 爆炸，爆裂
  A tyre burst during the second run.（在第二次运行时轮胎爆裂了。）
  The balloon burst.（气球爆了。）

- vt.& vi. 突然打开
  We burst the door open.（我们突然把门打开。）
  While I was reading, the door burst open and John came in.（我正在读书时，门突然开了，约翰走了进来。）

notes.title: 文化背景
notes.content:
邦纳维尔盐滩（Bonneville Salt Flats）位于美国犹他州西部，是一个巨大的盐湖床，面积超过30,000英亩。由于其平坦的表面和坚硬的盐层，这里成为了进行高速赛车和创造速度纪录的理想场所。

马尔科姆·坎贝尔爵士（Sir Malcolm Campbell，1885-1948）是英国著名的赛车选手和速度纪录创造者。他在1924年至1935年间多次创造陆地速度纪录，最终在1935年达到了每小时301.129英里的速度。他的儿子唐纳德·坎贝尔（Donald Campbell，1921-1967）继承了他的事业，不仅创造了陆地速度纪录，还创造了水上速度纪录。

'蓝鸟'（Bluebird）是坎贝尔家族用来创造速度纪录的一系列车辆和船只的名称。这个名字来源于莫里斯·梅特林克的戏剧《蓝鸟》，象征着追求幸福和梦想。从1911年开始，坎贝尔家族使用这个名字来命名他们的速度纪录车辆，这个传统一直延续到今天。
